subject: Nutrition
title: The Billion-Dollar Supplement Industry
description: A 60-second lesson on The Billion-Dollar Supplement Industry.

hook.text: Americans spend over $50 billion yearly on dietary supplements. Most have no proven health benefit.

buildup.text: The 1994 DSHEA law allows supplements to be sold without proving safety or effectiveness first.

discovery.text: Unlike drugs, supplements don't need FDA approval before reaching store shelves.

twist.text: Tests have found supplements with unlisted ingredients, wrong dosages, or no active ingredient at all.

punchline.text: Most supplements sell hope, not health.
